TopicTitle: Game Becomes Unresponsive after Hovering over Contracts

Articles.Content:
I've had this problem since the latest updates where after hovering over the contracts 

1. Hover over contracts button upper right of screen.

2. Game Lags / may become unresponsive "blue circle may appear"

3. Game becomes unresponsive and may display windows unresponsive message.

4. Clicking "Wait for Program to Respond" resolves the issue.

Windows 8.1

Kerbal 1.04

Flight Engineer 1.0.17

I have this issue also, I use coherent contracts and contract configurator with a lot of contract packs. I have to be careful to not hover over the stock contract button.

WIN 7 64

 If that is all of your mods then the only thing we have in common is KER but that just does not seem it would have any affect.

I also use KSP-ASV

I am going to play stock or very close to for a while, KER and alarm clock, see if I get the same results.
Just for giggles, check to see if sticky keys are enabled in windows. Disable
Sticky keys have been disabled on my PC.
Any chance someone with this problem can deliberately provoke this and then upload an output\_log.txt file?

Are you using Contract Configurator? Other contract mods, or all stock for "contract" stuff? What are the contracts that you have accepted.

The bug (stock KSP bug) is that updates to the contracts window get queued up until you open it. I've done a \*lot\* of changes in Contract Configurator over time to work around this, but it's certainly possible to see it in a stock game.

The bright side is that I'd imagine that with the Unity 5 rewrite this bug will go away in KSP 1.1. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'm all stock for contract stuff. It seems to have not occurred as drastically recently. A few contracts that I've recently cleared were one of the building a station on the moon with 2,000 units of fuel and the taking seismic measurements on the surface of minus. It also could be related to the number of contracts but I can't confirm this as I'm still getting a little delay but have not experienced it where the system message presents itself.
